Aah, Counter-Strike Source.

This game has many good AND bad things. I'll start with the bad ones.

- Community. 'Terrible' is one word to describe it. 'Childish' is another one. The game is full of little children who think this is serious business. You will hear the sentences 'Owned noob', 'omg awp noob', 'omg you idiot' and other sentences which have 'noob' or 'omg' in it a lot. Too much if you ask me.

Also Microphone spam and admin abuse are not uncommon.

- Quiet unbalanced weapons. There are only a few weapons people use. Those include M4A1, AK47 (both assault rifles), Desert Eagle (secondary handgun) and the AWP (a powerful, and usually one-hit-killing sniper). Many other weapons are just plain useless in short- and long-range.

- Cheaters. Servers are usually secured using VAC (Valve's Anti Cheat). I had always though that it has been effective against cheaters but I was wrong. VAC works like this: someone starts cheating, using wallhack, aimbot or any other thing that injects itself into the game, or modifies important .dll files. VAC is then supposed to find that out and it will ban you from every VAC secured (which are like 90% of all servers) server......after a week. It's a delayed ban, making VAC pretty useless. Also, if your account had been hijacked and the hacker cheated on your game, you're over. All games with the same engine (CSS uses the source engine. The same source engine which Half Life 2 Deathmatch and I also think Team-Fortress 2 + Day of Defeat: Source use. Left 4 Dead 1 / 2 and Garry's mod are on a different source engine) will get banned, and the worst part is, is that it is permanent. There's no point in asking for proof / unban. It will never happen and has never happened. You can find more info about VAC here: https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=7849-RADZ-6869
Anyway, there are many cheats out there on the net which are undetectable by VAC, and since it takes atleast a week for VAC to ban you, you will notice lots of cheaters.


And now the positives

+ Great gameplay! The game is fun to play if you are good enough. New players usually don't like this game because of the difficulty. After you understand how things work, the game gets fun.

+ Community created mods and maps. There are thousands of community created maps and mods, and most of them are fun to play. Known mods are Zombiemod where one player becomes a zombie and has to infect other players by melee attacking them, there's a Deathmatch mod, which means that you respawn after you die. Normally, after you'd die, you have to wait until the round is finished before you can play.

+ Surf. There are lots of surf maps. Surf is a special mode, which started somewhere in Half life 1. Explaining it is quiet difficult, your best bet would be to go on youtube and look at surf videos, but I'll try my best to explain it.
There are blocks, the blocks are so steep, when you try to stand on it, you will just slide down. People found out that if you went at the right speed, you could surf (or some people prefer to call it sliding) on those steep blocks. You can reach certain parts of maps etc. It's a real fun game mode to play.

+ Friends. If you have friends, you have fun. If you're part of a community, you have more fun. If you know the guys from the community quiet good, you have the most fun.
It's incredibly fun to play on a server with some mates of yours. Not on official maps, but on fun maps, such as glass_ maps. Such maps are usually conisisting out of glass floors, so you can shoot the floor under your friends.

+ The graphics. The graphics are not that bad for a 2004 game, and the system requirements are surprisingly low. However, the source engine is more CPU than GPU intensive, so a little p4 will even do. 

So yeah, this game had great potential, but got partially ruined by the community. The game is still fun with friends, or sometimes also with strangers. If you want a really challenging online FPS with loads and loads of different game modes and maps, this game may be right for you.

Эх, скок воспоминаний...

Die verschiedenen Modien waren das lustigste. Ob "Militia Only", "Zombie Escape" oder "Minigames". Bei Counter Strike: Source hatte ich bis in die frühen Morgenstunden Spielspaß pur! Mit Freunden hat es am meisten Spaß gemacht. Leider sind fast alle Server inzwischen leer. Aber Erinnerungen bleiben für immer! <3

This game has stood the tests of time. It came out way back in 2004 and it is still has a large amount of players. The graphics are great considering when it came out and it doesn't require an overly beefy computer to run. There isn't as much competitive play as CS:GO but there still are competitive games 12 years later. The gameplay is a lot less clunky than CS:GO. Your character moves faster and smoother compared to CS:GO, where it feels like your a turtle when walking with a rifle. The weapons are more balanced than those in CS:GO in my opinion. CS:GO has so many nerfs and buffs it's not even funny. We all remember the R8 Revolver's 1 hit kill body shots. And let's not even get started on the Tec-9. However, all the nerf's and buffs isn't a bad thing. It means valve is still doing updates and trying to listen to the community on issues. CS:S doesn't have much is any of this. There may be the occasional bug fix every once in a great while but content really hasnt changed. But this doesn't mean the game is dead. Maybe it just means the game is so balanced and good already that they don't need to change it? We need to bring back Source to its glory days! Where the game was played not because we wanted to show off our 1000 dollar knife skins but because we actualy wanted to have fun in a competitive balanced game.
Melhor jogo para desestressar um pouco. Recomendo!
